data.description: genMnemonic is used to sign up a new user by hirarchecal deterministic wallet system integrated in OBD. OBD returns mnemonic words to the client who signs up, and create a new user by the hash of the mnemonic words as the UserID.
LogIn is used to login to OBD.
createInvoice is used to generate an invoice for receiver.

parameters.name: h
parameters.help: The H (Hash of a Preimage R) currently is Public Key of a wallet address, and the R (Preimage R) is Private Key of a wallet address. This is a temporary solution.

parameters.name: expiry_time
parameters.help: Example: 2020-7-16

parameters.name: description
parameters.help: A memo

data.description: connectP2PPeer is a temp func in debugging mode. It connects to a p2p node.
OpenChannel is used to request to create a channel with someone.

parameters.name: funding_pubkey
parameters.help: This Public Key of a wallet address will be used to generate a channel 2-2 multi-sig address.

data.description: AcceptChannel is used to response to request of creating channel. Bob replies to accept, his OBD completes his message and routes it to Alice's OBD. Then Alice sees the response of acceptance.

parameters.name: temporary_channel_id
parameters.help: After invoked the OpenChannel API by counterparty, OBD will generate a temporary channel id.

parameters.name: funding_pubkey
parameters.help: This Public Key of a wallet address will be used to generate a channel 2-2 multi-sig address with another PubKey from counterparty.

data.description: FundingBTC is used for depositing bitcoin into a channel. Since the basic Omnilayer protocal uses BTC as miner fee in transferring assets, this message -102109 is special for depositing BTC for future transactions.  NOTE: For the current design, [FundingBTC] need to be run 3 times. And every time [FundingBTC] done, [BTCFundingCreated] and [BTCFundingSigned] need to be run in order. Omni Core will support sendmany soon, so the 3 times BTC funding will not be required in the next version of OBD.

parameters.name: from_address
parameters.help: Has some bitcoin in this address.

parameters.name: from_address_private_key
parameters.help: OBD create a transfer commitment transaction and use this private key to sign it but not broadcast.

parameters.name: to_address
parameters.help: This is channel 2-2 multi-sig address generated after AcceptChannel API invoked with counterparty.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.help: Minimum sending 0.00014184 BTC.

data.description: BTCFundingCreated is used to notify the success of funding BTC to the counterparty of the channel. Alice tells her OBD to notify Bob that she created the funding transaction by payloads packed in this message -3400.

parameters.name: channel_address_private_key
parameters.help: OBD create a revockable delivery transaction (RD Transaction). This private key used to sign the RD transaction. The RD transaction get bitcoin of deposit to channel (type 1009) back to sender if counterparty always does not response.

parameters.name: funding_tx_hex
parameters.help: The commitment transaction hex created in fundingBTC api (type 1009).

data.description: BTCFundingSigned is used to response the transfering bitcoin event by the partner of the channel. Bob tells his OBD to reply Alice that he knows the funding by message -3500.

parameters.name: channel_address_private_key
parameters.help: This key is the private key of the Bob's address used to create the Channel Address. OBD use the private key to sign the RD transaction created by BTCFundingCreated (Alice sent type -3400). This RD transaction get bitcoin of deposit to channel (type 1009) back to Alice if Bob always does not response.

parameters.name: funding_txid
parameters.help: The commitment transaction txid created in fundingBTC api (type 1009).

data.description: FundingAsset do: Alice starts to deposit omni assets to the channel. This is quite similar to the the btc funding procedure.

parameters.name: from_address
parameters.help: Has some omni assets in this address.

parameters.name: from_address_private_key
parameters.help: OBD create a transfer commitment transaction and use this private key to sign it but not broadcast.

parameters.name: to_address
parameters.help: This is channel 2-2 multi-sig address generated after AcceptChannel API invoked with counterparty.

parameters.name: property_id
parameters.help: This is property id of a omni asset.

data.description: AssetFundingCreated is used to notify the success of omni asset funding transaction to the counter partner of the channel.

parameters.name: temp_address_pub_key
parameters.help: This public key of an address (Alice2 in picture below) will be used to create a temp 2-2 multi-sig address as output 0 of C1a transaction.

parameters.name: temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: This private key of an address (Alice2 in picture below) will be used to sign RD1a transaction. The RD1a transaction get omni asset in channel back to Alice after a certain time (like seq = 1000 blocks) if Alice forced to close channel (broadcast C1a transaction).

parameters.name: channel_address_private_key
parameters.help: This private key of the address used to create the Channel Address. OBD create C1a transaction and use the private key to sign it. The C1a transaction represents the balance distribution in the channel.

parameters.name: funding_tx_hex
parameters.help: The commitment transaction hex created in FundingAsset api (type 2001).

data.description: AssetFundingSigned is used to response the transfering omni asset event by the partner of the channel. Bob tells his OBD to reply Alice that he knows the funding by message -35, and OBD will creat commitment transactions (C1a & RD1a).

parameters.name: temporary_channel_id
parameters.help: The temporary channel id created in AssetFundingCreated api (type -100034).

parameters.name: fundee_channel_address_private_key
parameters.help: This private key of the counterparty (Bob) address used to create the Channel Address. OBD use the private key to sign the C1a and RD1a transactions created by AssetFundingCreated (type -34).

data.description: RSMC Commitment Transaction Created is used for paying omni assets by Revocable Sequence Maturity Contract(RSMC) within a channel. After creating a channel and funding the channel by BTC and assets, Alice/Bob then is able to use this channel to pay to the counterparty. OBD constructs commitment transaction for each payment between the two counterparties. The i-th commitment transaction will be invalidated after creating the (i+1)-th commitment transaction. [These temp addresses] are some data generated by OBD used in contructing temporary multi-sig addresses and temporary transactions for i-th commitment transaction. You shall find your corresponding temporary data within the responses of your OBD.

parameters.name: channel_address_private_key
parameters.help: This private key used by Alice to create the channel. It will be used to sign C2a transaction in below picture as <Alice Sig>.

parameters.name: curr_temp_address_pub_key
parameters.help: This public key of an address (Alice3 in below picture) will be used to create a temp 2-2 multi-sig address as output 0 of newer Cx transaction like C2a in below picture.

parameters.name: curr_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: This private key of an address (Alice3's) will be used to sign RD2a transaction in below picture. The RD transaction get omni asset in channel back to Alice delay a lock time (like seq = 1000 blocks) if Alice forced to close channel (broadcast C2a transaction).

parameters.name: last_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: See below picture, this is the private key of Alice2 in the last RSMC transaction (C1a). It will be used to sign BR1a transaction. When Alice cheats, the BR transaction will punish Alice and transfer all assets belonging to Alice to Bob.

data.description: RSMC revokeAndAcknowledgeCommitmentTransaction is used for Receiver revoke the previous commitment transaction and ackonwledge the new transaction.

parameters.name: msg_hash
parameters.help: Commitment hash of C2a transaction created by Alice.

parameters.name: channel_address_private_key
parameters.help: This is the private key used by Bob to create the channel. It will be used to sign C2a and BR1a transaction in below picture as Bob Sig. And used to create and sign C2b, RD2a transaction.

parameters.name: curr_temp_address_pub_key
parameters.help: This public key of an address (Bob3 in below picture) will be used to create a temp 2-2 multi-sig address as output 0 of newer Cx transaction like C2b in below picture.

parameters.name: curr_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: This private key of an address (Bob3's) will be used to sign RD2b transaction in below picture. The RD transaction get omni asset in channel back to Bob delay a lock time (like seq = 1000 blocks) if Bob forced to close channel (broadcast C2b transaction).

parameters.name: last_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: See below picture, this is the private key of Alice2 in the last RSMC transaction (C1a). It will be used to sign BR1a transaction. When Alice cheats, the BR transaction will punish Alice and transfer all assets belonging to Alice to Bob.

data.description: HTLCFindPath is used to find a routing between A and B node for launch a HTLC transfer.
HTLCCreated is used for looking for a path to transfer to target and Send H to middleman.

parameters.name: property_id
parameters.help: The property id of an omni asset.

parameters.name: h
parameters.help: The H (Hash of a Preimage R) currently is Public Key of a wallet address, and the R (Preimage R) is Private Key of a wallet address. This is a temporary solution.

parameters.name: routing_packet
parameters.help: The path from sender to final receiver.

parameters.name: cltv_expiry
parameters.help: The.

parameters.name: channel_address_private_key
parameters.help: This is the private key used by Alice to create the channel. It will be used to sign C2a and BR2a transaction in below picture as Alice Sig.

parameters.name: curr_rsmc_temp_address_pub_key
parameters.help: This public key of an address (Alice's address in output 0 of C2a in below picture) will be used to create a temp 2-2 multi-sig address as output 0 of newer Cx transaction like C2a in below picture.

parameters.name: curr_rsmc_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: This private key of an address (Alice's) will be used to sign RD2a and BR2a transaction in below picture.

parameters.name: curr_htlc_temp_address_pub_key
parameters.help: This public key of an address (Alice's address in output 2 of C2a in below picture) will be used to create a temp 2-2 multi-sig address as output 2 of newer Cx transaction like C2a in below picture.

parameters.name: curr_htlc_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: This private key of an address (Alice's) will be used to sign HED1a transaction in below picture.

parameters.name: curr_htlc_temp_address_for_ht1a_pub_key
parameters.help: This public key of an address (Alice's address in output 2 of C2a in below picture) will be used to create a temp 2-2 multi-sig address as output 2 of newer Cx transaction like C2a in below picture.

parameters.name: curr_htlc_temp_address_for_ht1a_private_key
parameters.help: This private key of an address (Alice's) will be used to sign HT1a transaction in below picture.

parameters.name: last_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: This is the private key used in last transaction by Alice. It will be used to sign ?  transaction in below picture as Alice Sig.

data.description: HTLCSigned is used to response a routing request by middleman.

parameters.name: commitment_tx_hash
parameters.help: The hash of commitment transaction created in HTLCCreated (type -40).

parameters.name: channel_address_private_key
parameters.help: This private key used by Bob to create the channel. It will be used to sign C2b and BR2b transaction in below picture as Bob Sig.

parameters.name: curr_rsmc_temp_address_pub_key
parameters.help: This public key of an address (Bob's address in output 1 of C2b in below picture) will be used to create a temp 2-2 multi-sig address as output 1 of newer Cx transaction like C2b in below picture.

parameters.name: curr_rsmc_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: This private key of an address (Bob's) will be used to sign RD2b and BR2b transaction in below picture.

parameters.name: curr_htlc_temp_address_pub_key
parameters.help: This public key of an address (Bob's address in output 2 of C2b in below picture) will be used to create a temp 2-2 multi-sig address as output 2 of newer Cx transaction like C2b in below picture.

parameters.name: curr_htlc_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: This private key of an address (Bob's) will be used to sign HE1b transaction in below picture.

parameters.name: last_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: This is the private key used in last transaction by Alice. It will be used to sign ?  transaction in below picture as Bob Sig.

data.description: HTLCSendVerifyR is used to forward R to a node.

parameters.name: r
parameters.help: The R (a Preimage R) currently is Private Key of a wallet address, and the H (Hash of a Preimage R) is Public Key of a wallet address. This is a temporary solution.

parameters.name: channel_address_private_key
parameters.help: This is the private key used by Bob to create the channel. It will be used to sign HTD1b transaction in below picture.

parameters.name: curr_htlc_temp_address_for_he1b_pub_key
parameters.help: This public key of an address will be used to create a temp 2-2 multi-sig address as HE1b in below picture.

parameters.name: curr_htlc_temp_address_for_he1b_private_key
parameters.help: This private key of an address will be used to sign HE1b transaction in below picture.

data.description: HTLCSendSignVerifyR: Reciever reverify R. If correct, then creates rest HTLC commitment transactions.

parameters.name: msg_hash
parameters.help: The hash of commitment transaction created in HTLCSendR (type -45).

parameters.name: r
parameters.help: The R (a Preimage R) currently is Private Key of a wallet address, and the H (Hash of a Preimage R) is Public Key of a wallet address. This is a temporary solution.

parameters.name: channel_address_private_key
parameters.help: This is the private key used by Alice to create the channel. It will be used to sign HERD1b transaction in below picture.

data.description: CloseHTLC is used to close a HTLC channel. For continue using OBD to transfer assets OR some reasons Alice need to close this HTLC channel between she and Bob. Then Alice launch the closing request.

parameters.name: channel_address_private_key
parameters.help: This is the private key used by Alice (launcher of the close request) to create the channel. It will be used to sign newer RSMC transaction like C3a.

parameters.name: last_rsmc_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: Private Key of creating temporary 2-2 multi-sig address in previous RSMC transaction.

parameters.name: last_htlc_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: Private Key of creating temporary 2-2 multi-sig address in previous HTLC transaction.

parameters.name: last_htlc_temp_address_for_htnx_private_key
parameters.help: Private Key of creating temporary 2-2 multi-sig address in previous HTLC htnx transaction.

parameters.name: curr_rsmc_temp_address_pub_key
parameters.help: This public key of an address will be used to create a temp 2-2 multi-sig address as output 0 of newer Cx transaction in RSMC.

parameters.name: curr_rsmc_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: This private key of an address will be used to sign newer RDxa and BRxa transaction.

data.description: CloseHTLCSigned is used to response the request of close HTLC channel.

parameters.name: msg_hash
parameters.help: The hash of commitment transaction created in CloseHTLC (type -49).

parameters.name: channel_address_private_key
parameters.help: This is the private key used by Bob (responser of the close request) to create the channel. It will be used to sign newer RSMC transaction like C3b.

parameters.name: last_rsmc_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: Private Key of creating temporary 2-2 multi-sig address in previous RSMC transaction.

parameters.name: last_htlc_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: Private Key of creating temporary 2-2 multi-sig address in previous HTLC transaction.

parameters.name: last_htlc_temp_address_for_htnx_private_key
parameters.help: Private Key of creating temporary 2-2 multi-sig address in previous HTLC htnx transaction.

parameters.name: curr_rsmc_temp_address_pub_key
parameters.help: This public key of an address will be used to create a temp 2-2 multi-sig address as output 0 of newer Cx transaction in RSMC.

parameters.name: curr_rsmc_temp_address_private_key
parameters.help: This private key of an address will be used to sign newer RDxa and BRxa transaction.

data.description: CloseChannel request to close a channel.
CloseChannelSigned response to request of close a channel.

parameters.name: request_close_channel_hash
parameters.help: The hash of request created in CloseChannel (type -38).

data.description: AtomicSwap notifies the counterparty an atomic swap is created. The background and process of atomic swap can be found in chapter 5 of the OmniBOLT specification.
AtomicSwapAccepted accepts or rejects a swap.
